content:
Hi!

@Jens Villadsen just showed an awesome presentation in our #nordics call, for setting up your own HAPI servers based on any existing implementation guide. This would make development and testing even more flexible than it currently is with the official sandbox of the Finnish PHR.

To use the method demonstrated by Jens the implementation guide should be published as a package. Would it be a big effort to publish the IG of the Finnish PHR (https://simplifier.net/guide/finnishphrimplementationguidestu5/finnishphrimplementationguidehomepage) as a package?
I'll gladly provide you with a demo or point you to the configuration if you'll provide the IG package ;)
And shout out to @James Agnew for the repo validator feature!
@Mikael Rinnetmäki - I can now confirm that your Kanta IG can be loaded into HAPI FHIR programmatically ;)
I'd love to learn about that feature. Is there anything I can read / watch to get started?
@Jose Costa Teixeira I can easily do a demo for you. Do you have a specific IG that you would like to see being demostrated?
@Mikael Rinnetmäki - a quickly hacked but working IG package can be found as attachment here that can be loaded up and into HAPI FHIR for demo purposes package.tgz
(evidently making chat.fhir.org a new FHIR IG registry :joy: )
